page.title: 04GUNBY CHURCH
page.content: The lovely little church in the Parish of Gunby stands on a small hillock in the centre of the village. Services that were once held regularly each Sunday, and attended by most of the villagers, have, in 1985, been reduced to two services a month. On the second Sunday in each month Holy Communion is taken at 8.30 a.m. and on the last Sunday on the month Evensong is sung at 5.00 p.m. The Rector, the Reverend Noel Stone, lives 3 miles away in South Witham. He is responsible for the Christian soul in that village as well as Gunby, Stainby and North Witham. Gunby Church, when filled to capacity will seat approximately 150 people, but an average attendance is perhaps fifteen, of which two will be Gunby residents, the others, regular church-goers from the neighbouring
